  46. ‌CAMLprim value caml_get_section_table(value unit)
  47. {
  48.   if (caml_params->section_table == NULL) caml_raise_not_found();
  49.   return caml_input_value_from_block(caml_params->section_table,
  50.                                      caml_params->section_table_size);
  51. }

  53. ‌struct bytecode {
  54.   code_t prog;
  55.   asize_t len;
  56. };
  57. ‌#define Bytecode_val(p) ((struct bytecode*)Data_abstract_val(p))

  59. /* Convert a bytes array (= LongString.t) to a contiguous buffer.
  60.    The result is allocated with caml_stat_alloc */
  61. ‌static char* buffer_of_bytes_array(value ls, asize_t *len)
  62. {
  63.   CAMLparam1(ls);
  64.   CAMLlocal1(s);
  65.   asize_t off;
  66.   char *ret;
  67.   int i;

  69.   *len = 0;
  70.   for (i = 0; i < Wosize_val(ls); i++) {
  71.     s = Field(ls, i);
  72.     *len += caml_string_length(s);
  73.   }

  75.   ret = caml_stat_alloc(*len);
  76.   off = 0;
  77.   for (i = 0; i < Wosize_val(ls); i++) {
  78.     size_t s_len;
  79.     s = Field(ls, i);
  80.     s_len = caml_string_length(s);
  81.     memcpy(ret + off, Bytes_val(s), s_len);
  82.     off += s_len;
  83.   }

  85.   CAMLreturnT (char*, ret);
  86. }

  88. ‌CAMLprim value caml_reify_bytecode(value ls_prog,
  89.                                    value debuginfo,
  90.                                    value digest_opt)
  91. {
  92.   CAMLparam3(ls_prog, debuginfo, digest_opt);
  93.   CAMLlocal3(clos, bytecode, retval);
  94.   code_t prog;
  95.   asize_t len;
  96.   enum digest_status digest_kind;
  97.   unsigned char * digest;
  98.   int fragnum;

  100.   prog = (code_t)buffer_of_bytes_array(ls_prog, &len);
  101.   caml_add_debug_info(prog, Val_long(len), debuginfo);
  102.   /* match (digest_opt : string option) with */
  103.   if (Is_some(digest_opt)) {
  104.     digest_kind = DIGEST_PROVIDED;
  105.     digest = (unsigned char *) String_val(Some_val(digest_opt));
  106.   } else {
  107.     digest_kind = DIGEST_LATER;
  108.     digest = NULL;
  109.   }
  110.   fragnum = caml_register_code_fragment((char *) prog, (char *) prog + len,
  111.                                         digest_kind, digest);
  112. #ifdef ARCH_BIG_ENDIAN
  113.   caml_fixup_endianness((code_t) prog, len);
  114. #endif
  115. #ifdef THREADED_CODE
  116.   caml_thread_code((code_t) prog, len);
  117. #endif

  119.   /* Notify debugger after fragment gets added and reified. */
  120.   caml_debugger(CODE_LOADED, Val_long(fragnum));

  122.   clos = caml_alloc_small (2, Closure_tag);
  123.   Code_val(clos) = (code_t) prog;
  124.   Closinfo_val(clos) = Make_closinfo(0, 2);
  125.   bytecode = caml_alloc_small (2, Abstract_tag);
  126.   Bytecode_val(bytecode)->prog = prog;
  127.   Bytecode_val(bytecode)->len = len;
  128.   retval = caml_alloc_small (2, 0);
  129.   Field(retval, 0) = bytecode;
  130.   Field(retval, 1) = clos;
  131.   CAMLreturn (retval);
  132. }

  134. /* signal to the interpreter machinery that a bytecode is no more
  135.    needed (before freeing it) */

  137. ‌CAMLprim value caml_static_release_bytecode(value bc)
  138. {
  139.   code_t prog;
  140.   struct code_fragment *cf;

  142.   prog = Bytecode_val(bc)->prog;
  143.   caml_remove_debug_info(prog);

  145.   cf = caml_find_code_fragment_by_pc((char *) prog);
  146.   CAMLassert(cf != NULL);

  148.   /* Notify debugger before the fragment gets destroyed. */
  149.   caml_debugger(CODE_UNLOADED, Val_long(cf->fragnum));

  151.   caml_remove_code_fragment(cf);

  153.   caml_stat_free(prog);
  154.   return Val_unit;
  155. }

  157. ‌CAMLprim value caml_realloc_global(value size)
  158. {
  159.   mlsize_t requested_size, actual_size, i;
  160.   value new_global_data, old_global_data;
  161.   old_global_data = caml_global_data;

  163.   requested_size = Long_val(size);
  164.   actual_size = Wosize_val(old_global_data);
  165.   if (requested_size >= actual_size) {
  166.     requested_size = (requested_size + 0x100) & 0xFFFFFF00;
  167.     caml_gc_message (0x08, "Growing global data to %"
  168.                      ARCH_INTNAT_PRINTF_FORMAT "u entries\n",
  169.                      requested_size);
  170.     new_global_data = caml_alloc_shr(requested_size, 0);
  171.     for (i = 0; i < actual_size; i++)
  172.       caml_initialize(&Field(new_global_data, i), Field(old_global_data, i));
  173.     for (i = actual_size; i < requested_size; i++){
  174.       Field (new_global_data, i) = Val_long (0);
  175.     }
  176.     caml_modify_generational_global_root(&caml_global_data, new_global_data);
  177.   }
  178.   return Val_unit;
  179. }

  181. ‌CAMLprim value caml_get_current_environment(value unit)
  182. {
  183.   return *Caml_state->current_stack->sp;
  184. }

  186. ‌CAMLprim value caml_invoke_traced_function(value codeptr, value env, value arg)
  187. {
  188.   /* Stack layout on entry:
  189.        return frame into instrument_closure function
  190.        arg3 to call_original_code (arg)
  191.        arg2 to call_original_code (env)
  192.        arg1 to call_original_code (codeptr)
  193.        arg3 to call_original_code (arg)
  194.        arg2 to call_original_code (env)
  195.        saved pc
  196.        saved env */

  198.   /* Stack layout on exit:
  199.        return frame into instrument_closure function
  200.        actual arg to code (arg)
  201.        pseudo return frame into codeptr:
  202.          extra_args = 0
  203.          environment = env
  204.          PC = codeptr
  205.        arg3 to call_original_code (arg)                   same 7 bottom words as
  206.        arg2 to call_original_code (env)                   on entrance, but
  207.        arg1 to call_original_code (codeptr)               shifted down 4 words
  208.        arg3 to call_original_code (arg)
  209.        arg2 to call_original_code (env)
  210.        saved pc
  211.        saved env */

  213.   value * osp, * nsp;
  214.   int i;

  216.   osp = Caml_state->current_stack->sp;
  217.   Caml_state->current_stack->sp -= 4;
  218.   nsp = Caml_state->current_stack->sp;
  219.   for (i = 0; i < 7; i++) nsp[i] = osp[i];
  220.   nsp[7] = (value) Nativeint_val(codeptr);
  221.   nsp[8] = env;
  222.   nsp[9] = Val_int(0);
  223.   nsp[10] = arg;
  224.   return Val_unit;
  225. }

  227. #else

  229. /* Dummy definitions to support compilation of ocamlc.opt */
